intro: Championella xanthantha, commonly known as the yellow champion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its striking yellow-orange flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1.5 meters. Its leaves are elliptical and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are clustered in terminal racemes. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats.
